com.percussion.services.publisher
Interface IPSEditionTaskDef

public interface IPSEditionTaskDef

The Edition Task Definition. It defines a pre or post task that will be executed when publishing an Edition.

Method Summary

          Get the continue on failure flag.

Method Detail

getTaskId

IPSGuid getTaskId()
Get the task id, the task id is the primary key identifying a particular task.

Returns:
the task id, never null for a persisted task.

setTaskId

void setTaskId(IPSGuid taskId)
Set the task id

Parameters:
taskId - the task id, never null.

getEditionId

IPSGuid getEditionId()
Get the parent edition id.

Returns:
the edition id, never null for a valid task.

setEditionId

void setEditionId(IPSGuid editionId)
Set the parent edition id.

Parameters:
editionId - the associated edition, never null.

getSequence

int getSequence()
Get the sequence number.

Returns:
the sequence of this task, a negative sequence indicates the task should be executed before the edition, with the smaller value going first. A positive sequence indicates the task should be executed after the edition, a smaller value going first.

setSequence

void setSequence(int sequence)
Set the sequence number.

Parameters:
sequence - the sequence, never null.

getExtensionName

String getExtensionName()
Get the extension name to be run. The extension must reference an IPSEditionTaskDef.

Returns:
the name of the extension to be run, may be null.

setExtensionName

void setExtensionName(String extensionName)
Set the extension name.

Parameters:
extensionName - the extension to be run.

getContinueOnFailure

boolean getContinueOnFailure()
Get the continue on failure flag.

Returns:
if this flag is true then this task can fail and the remaining tasks will be run. false indicates that if this task fails, then all future tasks should be cancelled. If a pre-edition task fails and this value is false then the edition will not be run.

setContinueOnFailure

void setContinueOnFailure(boolean continueOnFailure)
Set the continue on failure flag.

Parameters:
continueOnFailure -

getParams

Map<String,String> getParams()
Get the parameters for this task.

Returns:
the parameters, never null but could be empty.

setParam

void setParam(String parameterName,
              String value)
If the passed parameter exists then this method updates the value, otherwise this method will add the parameter.

Parameters:
parameterName - the parameter name, never null or empty
value - the parameter value, if null or empty the parameter will be removed.

removeParam

void removeParam(String name)
Remove the given parameter

Parameters:
name - the parameter to remove, never null or empty.

getVersion

Integer getVersion()
Returns:
get the hibernate version, null for unsaved objects.
